overview: From 2025-12-01 to 2026-01-01, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 38 new PRs (31 merged), 12 new issues, and 51 active contributors.

topIssues.title: SPIKE: Decide how to support challenging ZK games
topIssues.author: ajsutton
topIssues.body:
Output is a P/PS deciding whether to:
* Support zk games in op-challenger (#18321) 
* Use succinct challenger for challenging ZK games
* Integrate challenging into proposer

topIssues.title: op-challenger: Support challenging ZK game types
topIssues.author: ajsutton
topIssues.body:
Introduce a new "trace type" (I regret not calling that game type now...) for ZK games. It should call the challenge method if it disagrees with the proposed output root and the game hasn't already been challenged.

It does not need to generate proofs or respond to challenges as part of this issue.

topIssues.title: SPIKE: Investigate which service should generate ZK proofs
topIssues.author: ajsutton
topIssues.body:
Output is a P/PS deciding where the ZK proof required for challenged proposals is generated. The known options are:
* Existing op-proposer (need to add proving)
* Proposer from op-succinct (potentially need to implement features from op-proposer and manage migration)
* op-challenger

A key input to this question is how easy it is to generate proofs from Go code vs Rust code. We should consider both Succinct's prover and RiscZero's given we intend to support both in the future.

topIssues.title: challenger: support challenger address changing
topIssues.author: pauldowman
topIssues.body: If the challenger's address changes, then any games challenged by the previous address will not be resolved

topPRs.title: op-challenger: Remove TraceType and just use GameType.
topPRs.author: ajsutton
topPRs.body:
**Description**
Remove TraceType and just use GameType.

Rename --trace-type to --game-types with an alias to preserve backwards compatibility.

Each trace type already directly maps to a GameType and the concept of a "trace" only exists for fault dispute games.

**Tests**

Mostly covered by existing tests with a couple added to ensure GameType has a suitable String() implementation and that the `--trace-type` alias works correctly.

**Additional context**

Builds on #18432 

**Metadata**

#18321

**Description**

**Metadata**

completedItems.body: Sometimes while working on superchain-ops or other repositories we get some custom error signature that can be hard to track. A useful tool is using `cast 4bd <sig>` . However this gets the signatures from https://openchain.xyz/ signature d

completedItems.title: ci: split bake workflow in protected/unprotected flows
completedItems.body:
This change improves security and it will also greatly reduce usage of our container registry. It splits the execution of the docker bake GHA workflow in 2:
- protected branches/tags: continues as is now to push images to GCP
- PRs: skip

completedItems.title: op-challenger: Challenge invalid ZK games
completedItems.body:
**Description**

Adds initial support for the optimistic ZK game type to op-challenger. Currently it only challenges games but doesn't resolve them or claim bonds back.

Notably it also doesn't check the proposal was safe according to t

completedItems.title: op-challenger: Introduce generic Player
completedItems.body:
**Description**

Introduces a generic `Player` implementation to handle checking sync status and prestate validation before delegating to a game specific actor.

Will save duplicating a bunch of boiler plate code for handling ZK games.

completedItems.title: op-challenger: Stop bundling asterisc
completedItems.body:
**Description**

Stop bundling asterisc with the op-challenger docker image. Remove asterisc-kona from default game types.

**Tests**

Updated unit tests. Manually confirmed the asterisc CLI options are not required.

completedItems.title: op-e2e: Test FPP for delegatecalled precompiles
completedItems.body:
Update the `Test_ProgramAction_Precompiles` tests to assert fault proof execution of precompiles that are delegatecalled. 

Depends on this kona fix https://github.com/op-rs/kona/pull/3117 before merging.
